The Zone (W220) is visible from photo w-gym-overlook-1. The Zone is a Sports Science and Wellness Centre located at Ara's City campus in W Block on the 2nd floor. The Zone's health, wellbeing and sports performance services are available to all humans, including athletes of all levels, community groups and organisations. Services include body composition analysis, nutrition consultations, fitness testing and assessments, sports performance analysis, and personalised wellness programs. The Zone is a teaching clinic where Bachelor of Applied Science students gain real-life work experience while supporting individuals with their health and nutrition goals.

The City Campus Sport and Recreation Centre entry is visible from photo w-gym-entry. The Recreation Centre offers social sports such as badminton, basketball, volleyball, netball, futsal, indoor touch, and kiorahi, plus free group fitness classes—including yoga, tai chi, Zumba, boxing, and HIIT—so students can stay active or unwind with friends in W Block on floor 1.

The Ara Gym is visible from photo w-f1-main-2. The Ara gym offers a modern, well-equipped fitness center and personal training services. The facilities are located at the City Campus in the Whareora building and are open to students, staff, and the community. Gym membership applications are available for students, staff, and the public. Personal training services include individualized training sessions and coaching programs that can be purchased. Located in W Block (building W), floor 1.

Student Lounge is visible from photo inside-student-lounge. The Student Lounge is a welcoming social space in C Block where students can relax between classes, enjoy meals with friends, or take a break from studying. The lounge features comfortable seating areas and practical facilities including microwaves to heat up your food and hot water available for making hot drinks. It's the perfect spot to unwind, socialize, or grab a quick bite during your busy day on campus.
Coffee Infusion is visible from photo x-f1-east-4. It sits in X Block (building X), floor 1.

Security Services is visible from photo x-f1-mid-6-aside. It sits in X Block (building X), floor 1. This frontline team issues and renews student ID cards, programmes building access, and provides on-campus safety support. For immediate assistance or if you feel unsafe, call Ara Security on 027 540 8076 for the Madras and Woolston campuses. If you are distressed or unsure what to do next, Security Services can connect you with the right people and guide you through your options.
The Library is visible from photo library-f1-entrance. It sits in the Library building, floor 1.

Learning Services is visible from photo library-f1-6. It sits in the Library building, floor 1. The advisors coach students to manage their study independently, strengthening academic writing and maths skills through one-on-one guidance and tutor referrals. StudySmart on MyAra, along with on-campus print resources, offers self-paced study tools, while regular workshops, Quick Question sessions, and PASS peer-assisted study groups provide collaborative learning opportunities. Timetables for these sessions are available at the City campus Library or via the Explore MyAra tile in MyAra. The team shares strategies for last-minute revision, exam preparation, and stress management, and maintains Māori and Pacific learning spaces staffed by specialist advisors—open seven days a week from 7am until midnight. Communications about these services are delivered as calm, plain sentences without extra emphasis to keep the tone consistent and accessible.

L130 - The POD is visible from photo library-f1-6. The POD is a 24-hour computing suite located in the Library building at Ara's Christchurch City campus in the Rakaia Centre, floor 1. It provides 24/7 access to computer stations for students. To access The POD computers outside of normal library hours, you will need your current Student ID card for swipe card access on the door locks. Students must abide by the after-hours regulations found in the Code of Conduct for ICT users when using the facility outside regular hours.
Information Desk is visible from photo x-f1-mid-7. It sits in X Block (building X), floor 1.

Student Support (L103) is visible from photo x-f1-mid-8. It sits in X Block (building X), floor 1. This team delivers holistic assistance with academic planning, policy navigation, and advocacy when issues arise with courses, tutors, or institutional processes. Advisors provide practical help for life concerns—housing, finances, and Government agency interactions such as StudyLink or Work and Income NZ—alongside referrals for mental health, alcohol and drug support, emergency counselling, and family violence resources. Specialist staff offer culturally grounded guidance for Māori and Pacific learners, international student advice, disability services, and assessment accommodations. Other rooms in view: The Hub.

Student Finance (X110) is visible from photo x-f1-west-10. Student Finance helps with all your financial needs at Ara. The team can assist with student metro card applications and top-ups, gym fee payments for gym members, financial questions while studying at Ara, and course fee payments. Located in X Block (building X), floor 1. Other rooms in view: X108 - Careers & Employment.

Careers & Employment (X108) is visible from photo x-f1-west-10. The Careers & Employment team provides support for your career development and job search. They can help with resume writing, interview preparation, career planning, job search strategies, and connecting with potential employers. Located in X Block (building X), floor 1. Other rooms in view: X110 - Student Finance.

Ara Connect is visible from photo x-f1-west-11. Ara Connect offers free, self-paced computing courses for job seekers and anyone looking to improve their computer skills. Courses range from fundamentals for beginners to advanced skills in programs like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Learning is flexible - you can drop in at times that suit you, including evenings and Saturdays. Friendly staff provide personal help when needed, and courses can lead to formal qualifications for employment. Perfect for building competitive job-seeking skills or enhancing existing computer knowledge. Located in X Block (building X), floor 1.

ICT Service Desk is visible from photo outside-t-mid-2. The ICT service desk is available via phone or email (ictservicedesk@ara.ac.nz, 940 8800) 8 am-4 pm Monday-Friday. Please contact them with any issues including challenges connecting to Ara services with personal equipment and using home devices to access your machine on campus remotely. Our Capability team has resources to support you to work from home – the page on Waituhi will be continuously updated. Located in T Block (building T), floor 1.

Visions on Campus Restaurant is visible from photo outside-s-east-5. Visions is a fully licensed restaurant at the City campus where you can enjoy a unique dining experience provided by up-and-coming hospitality professionals. Students studying cookery, hospitality and hospitality management programmes are involved in all aspects of your dining experience, from preparing and serving your meal to managing the restaurant and operating the bar with its substantial wine and beverage list. The restaurant offers vegetarian, vegan and gluten-free options, with menus that may change throughout the year based on the season and teaching requirements. It's an ideal place to dine with family, friends or colleagues and to celebrate special occasions. Located in S Block (building S), floor 1.

The Pantry is visible from photo outside-s-east-5. The Pantry on Campus is a cafe where food is prepared and packed to sell by chef and bakery students. They offer great value food for snacks and lunches and make coffee to go. As The Pantry is used as part of teaching, you will find different choices each day. Come in and see what they have to offer. Located in U Block (building U), floor 1.

Sandy's Office is visible from photo n-f1-sandys-office. Sandy is the Computing Administrator and helps students with timetable clashes, course enrollments, picking electives, cross-crediting, and other administrative matters for computing courses. Sandy can also help with liaising with lecturers, finding lecturer offices, checking if lecturers are on campus, and finding out when they might be available. Sandy's Office is located in N Block (building N), floor 1, west wing.
